There are estimated to be anything up to 31,000 CSOs operating in the UK.

name: Surfers Against Sewage
text: RT @LDNWaterkeeper: Last night sewage levels in the River Lea peaked again. Ammonium rose & at the same time dissolved oxygen crashed to 10…
retweet_text:
Last night sewage levels in the River Lea peaked again. Ammonium rose & at the same time dissolved oxygen crashed to 10% (bacteria use up the O2 putting fish under stress). 
This is no way to treat a river. The Lea will never fully recover until this destructive cycle is ended. https://t.co/E47W0t7JKq

text:
One cigarette butt can pollute up to 7.5litres of seawater. An estimated 4.5trillion are thrown away worldwide per year.

Join our #ReturnToOffender campaign to help us hold these companies to account to do more for the environment:

https://t.co/XgzdEYwNRH

name: Surfers Against Sewage

As I’d like to save the planet,
I bought it for each kittiwake
and albatross, and gannet,
To tr…
retweet_text:
I bought a bamboo toothbrush,
As I’d like to save the planet,
I bought it for each kittiwake
and albatross, and gannet,
To try to send a message out
To everyone like me,
Who always bought the plastic ones,
Which end up in the sea.

text:
⚠️A timely reminder: don't pour fats or oils down your sink this Xmas. Let them to cool then recycle or bin.

Otherwise they stick to sewer walls - stopping sewage from being processed, leading to raw sewage spillovers into rivers, seas or our homes.💩🤮

https://t.co/IC8RdHWcCr

name: Surfers Against Sewage
text:
The year’s #COP25 UN climate summit is the first-ever “Blue COP,” a nod to the key role oceans play in regulating our global climate. 

Oceans have absorbed ~93% of excess heat from human-caused climate change. It's crucial we protect them.

https://t.co/GJhK8WXYsy

name: Surfers Against Sewage
text:
RT @BeTheBigChange: My favorite bird
a Gannet
ever majestic
wild
now no more 

drowned
in seawater
tangled up
in man-made plastic

there yo…
retweet_text:
My favorite bird
a Gannet
ever majestic
wild
now no more 

drowned
in seawater
tangled up
in man-made plastic

there you lay
washed up
for my feet
looking
in my sad eyes.

at the cliffs
I burried you
stone by stone
rest in peace. 

AFdK
7-12-2019

Please RT
#TurnTheTideOnPlastic https://t.co/hoWpYIDR8L

name: Surfers Against Sewage
text:
⚠️⚠️ Protect our beaches, don’t pour fats, oils & grease (FOGs) down the sink. Leave fat to cool then recycle or bin it.

When we pour FOGs down sinks, they cool & stick to sewer walls - stopping systems working fully & leading to raw sewage spillovers 💩🤮 #Unblocktober https://t.co/3AOIP70g4z

text: RT @lucysiegle: Ok but define ‘excessive?’ All plastic that does not have a linear recycling route and achievable second life destination o…
retweet_text: Ok but define ‘excessive?’ All plastic that does not have a linear recycling route and achievable second life destination or is not reusable multiple times without changing formats is excessive. That pretty much rules out 99% of packaging polymers! https://t.co/d9l0y8MvoE
